address: Av. 5 de Mayo 61 Cuauht√©moc, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06000 Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX, Mexico
topic: place, wonderful, visit, castle, great, time, lots, awesome, day, go
text: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Zocalo Central for a week in June. I chose this hotel because of a very positive previous experience years before. If anything, Hotel Zocalo Central was even better than the last time. It‚Äôs a beautiful property a short walk from Plaza Central and a pedestrian mall lined with shops, restaurants, parks and museums. But it‚Äôs the staff that makes this hotel great. Here is an example. I had always wanted to see Lucha Libre, a colorful, dramatic and acrobatic Mexican version of WWE entertainment wrestling in the US. Emblematic of this Mexican form of wrestling, the Luchadores (wrestlers) wear colorful snug-fitting masks called mascaras. I asked at the desk, and they sent me to Leyka, the concierge. My last chance to attend Lucha Libre before we went home was at Arena Mexico the next evening. It was complicated to acquire a ticket and find a good seat at the last minute. Leyka took over and tracked down a ticket only five rows from ringside. I was so excited. The next day I stopped by to thank Leyka and she presented me with my own mascara de Luchador. It was as colorful and well-made as the ones worn by the Luchadores in the ring. That night I had such a great time. The pageantry of Lucha Libre features a Good vs Evil theme. The observers are very much involved in what's going on in the ring, and the arena throbbed with the passionate crowd. I feel very attached to Hotel Zocalo Central and will certainly stay there again.

address: Historic center of Mexico City, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06000 Mexico City, Mexico
topic: love, recommended, highly, expensive, fine, pozole, recommend, everything, great, place
text:
On a college trip to Mexico City with Canisius, I visited the heart of the city‚Äîthe Z√≥calo, which is the modern-day name for the main square. The experience was incredible, especially learning how this bustling plaza sits atop the ruins of the ancient city of Tenochtitlan, the capital of the Aztec Empire. This space, which today is surrounded by the grandeur of colonial-era architecture and governmental buildings, once housed the very center of the Aztec world. It‚Äôs a living testament to Mexico‚Äôs layered history.

As I stood in the square, I couldn‚Äôt help but feel the weight of what was beneath my feet. Tenochtitlan, which was founded in 1325, was one of the largest cities in the world at its height, sitting on an island in the middle of Lake Texcoco. The Aztecs engineered a sophisticated city with floating gardens (chinampas) and canals that rivaled those of Venice. The location of the Z√≥calo itself was the site of Templo Mayor, a grand temple dedicated to the gods Huitzilopochtli and Tlaloc. Although the Spaniards destroyed much of it during their conquest in 1521, you can still see remnants of the temple through archaeological excavations, which are visible right off the square.

The energy of the Z√≥calo is palpable‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs the musicians playing traditional tunes, the street vendors selling indigenous crafts, or the vibrant political protests that sometimes fill the space. It‚Äôs one of those places where the past and present seem to coexist so naturally. The knowledge that Tenochtitlan was a thriving metropolis, built with precision and spiritual significance, made me appreciate the enduring influence of Aztec culture on modern-day Mexico.

Walking through the nearby Museo del Templo Mayor and seeing artifacts, such as stone carvings, sculptures, and sacrificial altars, brought this history to life even more. I remember staring at a giant stone disc depicting Coyolxauhqui, the goddess dismembered by her brother Huitzilopochtli, in awe of how the Aztecs used art to tell their powerful myths.

Visiting the Z√≥calo and understanding that it sits on the bones of Tenochtitlan, I realized how much of history can remain hidden beneath the surface‚Äîboth literally and figuratively. It was a profound experience that made me rethink how I view urban spaces, as every stone and structure seemed to have a story waiting to be uncovered. It‚Äôs a reminder that cities are built on the legacies of civilizations past, and the Z√≥calo is one of the best places to see those layers right in front of you.

This hotel is well  located within the historical area and there are many sites walking distance of the hotel. There‚Äôs also a hop on hop off bus area close to hotel. Great place but hears a tip they didn't tell me. On a sunny day, the checkered balcony where everyone wants to take pics; unnaturally bright from the reflective floor. So bring sunglasses just for the floor.

Anyways, very cool castle. Didn't see any grasshoppers though.

address: Av. 5 de Mayo 61 Cuauht√©moc, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06000 Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX, Mexico
topic: hotel, location, view, staff, great, breakfast, stay, loved, rooms, pleasant
text:
I spent 4 days at this property in July to celebrate my 62nd birthday and enjoy CDMX.  The property, staff, amenities, food, and location are excellent.  The 24/7 Central Cafe was especially convenient and the food tasty.

I would like to acknowledge the customer-centered culture I saw in each and every hotel employee that I interacted with.  From the housekeeper to the General Manager.  Everyone was friendly, professional, and happy to work at the hotel.

The staff definitely made this trip and birthday a memorable experience.  I would like to especially acknowledge our bellboy, Raul, who greeted us upon checking in, the concierge, Leyka, for her friendliness and assistance that she provided us.  A special thank you goes to Eric, the manager-in-charge who upgraded my room due to an issue with my initial room.  The General Manager, Nancy Gutierrez, went above and beyond in providing her personal touch to my visit.

I highly recommend the hotel and excellent staff to friends, family, and anyone looking for a hotel centrally located adjacent to the Zocalo.
name: Enrique Gonzalez

topic: place, wonderful, visit, castle, great, time, lots, awesome, day, go
text:
The hotel was beautifully appointed. Every morning we were treated to a delicious breakfast at the roof top terrace overlooking the metropolitan cathedral and the national palace. In the evening we could enjoy courtesy drinks and snacks The staff were always attentive and accommodating. The room was small but very clean and comfortable. Cold bottled water and fresh apples were available to guests 24/7, also free of charge. The location was close to many historic sites and walking distance to the Palacio de Bellas artes, the meeting point for a lot of guided tours. The location
was not as clean or modern as Reforma and definitely more crowded but I enjoyed the central location to many attractions, shopping, and restaurants.

address: Av. 5 de Mayo 61 Cuauht√©moc, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06000 Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX, Mexico
topic: hotel, location, view, staff, great, breakfast, stay, loved, rooms, pleasant
text:
Group of 5, booked a set of three rooms twice in July 2025.

Positives:
Great location and views in the central square / Zocalo.
Good service -- 24/7 snack bar, good breakfast included.
Spacious rooms and good beds / linens.

Negatives:
Could not sleep, there was music outside the hotel through the night (until after 5 AM). You can say that comes with the location, but not being able to sleep is a negative nevertheless.
WiFi is spotty, cannot rely on it for work calls. The signal was great but at times there was no internet access.
A/C thermostats don't seem to have effect, if you turn A/C on it just keeps cooling, so at night you have the choice of too hot or too warm.

address: Av. 5 de Mayo 61 Cuauht√©moc, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06000 Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX, Mexico
topic: hotel, location, view, staff, great, breakfast, stay, loved, rooms, pleasant
text: We were delighted with our 17 -night stay last April at this elegant hotel in the historic centre of Mexico City. The staff were kind, friendly, and especially  helpful to us as non-Spanish speaking pensioners. Our room was comfortable, spotless, well-maintained and with coffee-making facilities.|Wide-ranging breakfast options included a varied buffet as well as dishes cooked to order such as enchiladas, which you can enjoy in a delightful balcony restaurant overlooking Latin America's biggest and grandest cathedral. You can have a four-course dinner here too, with multiple Mexican and international dishes on offer, and a spectacular view from the balcony by moonlight.. In addition, an attractive garden cafe bar, reached from above by a pleasing see-through lift, serves free food and drink to guests all day. Anyone staying in Mexico City could do no better than be guests of Zocalo Central Hotel.

text: I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Zocalo Central and I would definitely book with them again. Ricardo greeted us as we walked in and out each day. When we checked into the hotel it was lovely to be able to go down to the 24 Hr cafe and grab something to eat instead of having to search for food on our first day. The wraps, salads and soup were really delicious. I loved sitting on the balcony each morning for breakfast. Breakfast was pretty much the same thing each morning. Fabian was our waiter the whole visit and he was awesome. Loved the complimentary bottle of wine and the walking tour with Daniella. She was very informative, did not rush us and professional. My only complaint is the shower. The shower head is placed too high. I am short and my sister who is a little taller than me both stated it was hard to position the shower head without getting it all in face and hair. Also my sisters tv had Netflix option and mine did not but definitely wasn‚Äôt a big deal because I rarely had it on. I loved my stay in Mexico City and already looking forward to coming back.

topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
FOREIGNERS BE CAREFUL!!!

We initially made a reservation through Booking.com, and it was a pre-established price (US$944.08). We even thought the amount had been charged to our card. However, I was surprised when I arrived at the hotel and was told that the reservation was only a pre-reservation and that I would have to pay the fees in the hotel lobby. The hotel attendant's attitude was extremely rude and impatient, as if we were the ones in the wrong. Not to mention that the "pre-reservation" price was not applied, and we paid a much higher amount than the amount stated at the time of booking. Since this initial attitude didn't seem like a mistake, but rather a dynamic, we checked the room rates on the day we checked in. The same room for the same number of days was US$835.00, while we had to pay US$1,558.07. We were extremely upset after the incident, but since there was no time to look for another place, we agreed to stay. In any case, the least a real hotel could do is refund the overcharged amount as quickly as possible.

text: My wife and I stayed for six nights in May at the Zocalo Central Rooftop Mexico City.  It was one of the nicest hotel stays we have had in years. The location of the hotel is very central, the beautiful Constitution Square is across the street. The hotel is very nicely designed, very clean and very well maintained. There are many amenities, a cool towel and a shot of tequila when you arrive, a bar / cafe where you can find a wide variety of snacks and drinks that are available for free 24/7 (you do pay for alcohol).¬∞ The rooms are very well appointed with comfortable beds and monogrammed towels. There is a beautiful restaurant on the rooftop that overlooks Constitution Square where you can have the complimentary breakfast the hotel offers. The breakfast menu was extensive, fresh, very well prepared and beautifully presented. The restaurant is also open for dinner.  But what I think my wife and I appreciated the most about the Zocalo was the staff.  Everyone was so professional and so nice to us.  Mexico City was beautiful and we saw some amazing sites, wonderful restaurants and beautiful museums, but the Zocalo was our oasis. We didn‚Äôt want to leave. Thanks to all the staff for helping to make our stay in Mexico City such a pleasant experience.
name: Tracy Bradshaw

address: Bosque de Chapultepec I Secc, Miguel Hidalgo, 11580 Mexico City, Mexico
topic: place, wonderful, visit, castle, great, time, lots, awesome, day, go
text:
Chapultepec Castle is located in the first section of Chapultepec Forest in Mexico City.
Its Baroque and Neoclassical design dates back to the Viceroyalty of New Spain, when the viceroys used to frequent Chapultepec to stroll and rest.
In 1840, the Heroic Military College established its headquarters in the castle. It also played a significant role in the Battle of Chapultepec as part of the American intervention in Mexico.
During the imperial transition, Maximilian of Habsburg and Charlotte lived in this castle, captivated by the beautiful views of the Valley of Mexico.
The castle also served as the presidential residence for most of the Mexican Revolution and until 1938.
A decree was issued requesting that the castle be used as the headquarters of the National Museum of History, and it opened its doors to the public for the first time on September 27, 1944.
Chapultepec Castle is the only castle in Latin America to have served as the official residence of a monarch.
It is open Tuesday through Sunday from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
General admission is 100 pesos and is free for children under 13, adults over 60, people with disabilities, and students and teachers with a valid ID.
If you travel to Mexico, be sure to visit the beautiful Chapultepec Castle. Its gardens and panoramic views are a must-see in the city.

topic: beautiful, cathedral, history, incredible, many, architecture, mexico, impressive, full, place
text:
A cathedral, which is incredibly beautiful, with imposing architecture both inside and outside, along with the National Palace of Mexico City, are some of the most visible and beautiful spots surrounding Constitution Square and Mexico City in general.
The Cathedral's many years of history are extremely rich, having been founded by order of King Philip II and under construction from 1573 to 1813. Inside, aside from being able to pray and engage in other religious activities, you can walk aisle by aisle, admiring the Cathedral's immense and precious interior architecture, along with some important historical pieces from the church itself. At every step, you feel an aura of majesty and grandeur, conveyed by the Cathedral's perfectly polished construction.
It is an iconic landmark of the capital, and also a must-see, which you will definitely see if you pass through this area. A total wonder and deservedly declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site, it is enchanting.

address: P.za de la Constituci√≥n S/N, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06000 Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX, Mexico
topic: beautiful, cathedral, history, incredible, many, architecture, mexico, impressive, full, place
text:
The Metropolitan Cathedral of Mexico City has been a World Heritage Site since 1987.
It is simply a beauty. Founded in 1570, the first stone was laid in 1571. Its construction took approximately 250 years, and it was inaugurated in 1813. It stands 67 meters high and covers an area of 7,752 m¬≤.
It is designed in Gothic, Plateresque, Baroque, Estipite, and Neoclassical styles.
It is a monument that dominates the Z√≥calo of Mexico City and is a must-see. The main altar, the Altar of the Kings, the Altar of Forgiveness, the naves and altars of the apse, the 14 chapels, the sacristy, the chapter house, the crypts, the remaining organs, the choir stalls, and the pendulum are all worth seeing and admiring for their beauty.
You can also climb the cathedral towers with a guide and admire the bell towers.
Admission is free, but climbing the bell towers and roofs costs 250 pesos per person.

text: The Z√≥calo-Tenochtitl√°n station is the connection with our ancestors. It allows us to identify what our ancient civilization was like, with those models and drawings that represent our historical past. Walking through its wide corridors resembles the corridors that the ancient inhabitants of this region walked through. Seeing their images or their representations in those three-dimensional shapes makes us understand the magnitude, strength, and intelligence that went into constructing those buildings and temples, as well as their worship of their gods. It also helps us understand their way of thinking and their messages engraved in paintings and reliefs. I particularly enjoy walking in this area full of stories from our ancient colonizers. Thank you.

text:
Beautiful spot downtown in Mexico City.
Colonial buildings surrounding Plaza de la Constituci√≥n are beautiful and well maintained. Also the Cathedral is just amazing in size. It's bells sound fill out the whole Z√≤calo.
At Plaza de la constituci√≥n, they install itinerant exhibitions, and decorations. So for sightseeing and walks this is great place to visit.
Also, there are several, museums, historical buildings, shops and  restaurants (all categories and prices) at a walking distance.

The central part, just down there at Z√≥calo and some other streets are just for pedestrians. So one can have very nice walking time there (early in the morning perhaps the best time as it is not to crowded)

It is easy to get there by subway. Other public transportations and taxes are available. But subway would be the best idea... as parking are expensive and not that happy experience if you decide to go there driving.

address: Bosque de Chapultepec I Secc, Miguel Hidalgo, 11580 Mexico City, Mexico
topic: nice, great, amazing, place, food, toronto, views, tacos, good, view
text:
Admission is FREE only on Sundays, but be prepared as it can get very crowded. I recommend arriving early due to the sun and heat. Food and drinks are not allowed inside. Bring sunscreen or an umbrella. It's a walk of at least an hour, or more depending on the number of people. The walk up to the castle from the park is at least a 10-minute walk. Wear comfortable clothing; the descent is easier.

I don't recommend bringing strollers or wheelchairs, as mobility isn't yet adapted.

- Bring a healthy lunch. Outside, they sell various snacks, chips, and food, but the prices are excessive, and I don't think the quality is the best.

- It's best to go inside the restrooms; there are long lines outside the castle, and you'll have to wait a long time.

- You're located near the lake and Reforma Avenue.
name: Libnny Ismerai

text:
Wow!  What an amazing experience overall.  From the beautiful decor, to the amazing staff, most notably the extremely helpful concierge Vianney and Patricia, Kenai (front desk) and Raul (door attendant) who went above and beyond to ensure we had the most pleasant stay.
Great value for the price!!  The breakfast was fabulous and the 24 hr free cafe service pretty much makes this place an "all-inclusive".  We would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting to stay in the Historic district of Mexico City.
Tips:  1. Splurge for the king suite (so worth it)  2. Enjoy dinners outside of the hotel especially in the beautiful walkable tree lined streets of Condesa.

address: 418 S Tejon St suite 100, Colorado Springs, CO 80903
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
We visited this restaurant on a Friday night, catching the tail end of their busy hour. The host greeted us and mentioned a 20-minute wait, jotting our name and number on a piece of paper. Interestingly, other guests and reservations appeared to be managed through a tablet system, so it felt a bit disorganized from the start.

We waited outside and noticed several larger parties being seated ahead of us. Assuming they had reservations, we waited patiently. However, after a while, we decided to check in‚Äîonly to realize that the hostess had clearly forgotten us. She seated us shortly after.

Our server was polite but seemed to lack proper training. She took our appetizer and drink orders together, then returned with drinks and took our dinner order. We received our entr√©es, but had to remind her about the appetizers, which arrived late. One of the meals came out incorrectly, but to her credit, she did correct it fairly quickly.

When it came time to pay, confusion set in. We had clipped our cards to the respective tabs, but the charges appeared to be mixed up. To avoid further complications, we covered the difference between ourselves. Later, we discovered that one card was charged twice, instead of charging the two separate cards provided.

As for the food‚Äîit was underwhelming.

Overall, the experience was more frustrating than enjoyable.
name: Lisa Byom

address: 418 S Tejon St suite 100, Colorado Springs, CO 80903
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
Came here with a group of 7 and overall‚Ä¶ it was underwhelming. Our server was decent at first, but once he realized the tip was automatically included, we barely saw him again; meanwhile, the smaller tables got the real attention. My plate honestly felt a little sad because the chicken was dry and lacked flavor. Also, for a brunch spot, not offering coffee is just wild to me.

The atmosphere and aesthetic were actually really nice, the space is bright and well put together, and the swings are a fun touch that definitely add to the vibe. But that only goes so far.

A $16+ breakfast burrito feels like a stretch. I know prices are up, but breakfast should be more accessible, not a luxury. Drinks were okay. I also tried the lobster quesadilla, and while it sounded fancy, it barely had any lobster despite the price.

All in all, great setting, but the food and service didn‚Äôt live up to it. Not in a rush to come back.

address: P.za de la Constituci√≥n S/N, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06000 Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX, Mexico
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
You can read the other reviews for the church itself. This one will focus on the catacomb / crypt (the guide called it a crypt) experience, since there's not much info about it online.

In essence, the catacomb / crypt tour is only on Fridays from 11am to ~4pm. I forget how much admission was, but it was pretty cheap (~$5 USD). You can only buy tickets in person from a guide posted in front of the middle chamber of the church; cash only.

The tour is ONLY in Spanish. You will see one or two side chambers of the church, then the middle chamber with the giant organs (some or the largest in North America), then descend steps from there down to the crypts. No photography is allowed except in the crypt where the former Archbishops were buried. Total tour time is ~1 hour.
name: Josephine Lee

topic: place, wonderful, visit, castle, great, time, lots, awesome, day, go
text: The Hotel Z√≥calo Central is an excellent hotel with an incredible location and superb amenities. The beds are very comfortable and the restaurant with breakfast, lunch and dinner has some of the best views of the Z√≥calo by far.  The prices are very reasonable given the fact that there is a cafe with complimentary food and beverage options all day long. And, the food and coffee is delicious. Free bottles of water are in fridges on every floor. The breakfast is excellent and the staff are all very friendly. There is a small gym, but you can also access Alameda park and the square very easily if you like to jog or run. My husband and I have stayed a few times, and it is always delightful. They even gave us an anniversary gift of two adorable stuffed penguins. My only negative comment would be that the wifi can be spotty and slow and our TV was not working properly , but these were minor details.

address: Bosque de Chapultepec I Secc, Miguel Hidalgo, 11580 Mexico City, Mexico
topic: place, wonderful, visit, castle, great, time, lots, awesome, day, go
text: We loved visiting the castle.  It has a lot of interesting artifacts, paintings and excellent views of the city and the angel.  The architecture of the castle is amazing.  I appreciate that there is an elevator, since we have a handicap person with us.  I must warn you that the hike up to the castle is quite long and I saw a few people nearly passing out.  But I think that if you are moderately active, the hike might be difficult but not impossible.  Beware of the food vendors in the food section. We ordered chicken and broth and were charged 90 pesos, for a very small bowl.  That was 20 pesos more than what I paid for a huarache with sudadero, which was larger and with more meat.  This was at the section with the blue umbrellas.  Our server forgot our order, when he finally brought it it was incomplete.  The chicken broth was not on the menu, so we didn't know the price.  It was my mistake for not asking the price before hand.  When I question him about the excessive cost, he said it was because it must of had a lot of chicken.  With prices in Mexico they would have to use half a chicken to justify the price.  Other than that insident, our trip was great.  You need the whole day to be able to explore more of Chapultepec.  A must see when in Mexico city.
name: Nancy Basco

topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
I was struggling to give 4 or 5 but after thinking about the housekeeping I give a 4

As mentioned the housekeeping is a disappointment. We left the room every morning and back around 4 with the clean room sign hanging at the door. The room was not cleaned and untouched. We had to ask them to come and clean them again around 5. I understand that was the busiest time of the year but not cleaning your room for such a long time. Guests just want a clean room to rest after a long day out

The gym is very small as people mentioned. The absurd thing is you cannot go to the gym on the first floor with your key card. You need to go to the reception and ask them to get you to the 1/f

The hotel is stylish and I like it
We also like the concept they give free drinks but the coffee is bad. It is coffee water not coffee .. I don‚Äôt know how

The location is a plus and minus. The plus side is you can easily access to the busiest area of the city and zocalo for sights and experience

The minus was since it was around Christmas time most of the time cars cannot get close to the hotel. The first time we came by taxi it took us triple the time and the taxi could not get into the hotel with all roads blocked
For the next coming days we could not get taxi right at the the hotel or dropping off at the spot
You simply need to walk 5 mins away from the busiest area to get the transportation

Other than these problems I would recommend to stay there but not during Christmas or festival times

address: 418 S Tejon St suite 100, Colorado Springs, CO 80903
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text: Went here yesterday on a whim with a friend. Was absolutely blown away by how amazing the food was! We happened to be there during happy hour, so all street tacos were discounted. I got four tacos and my friend got three tacos and a chimichanga to go. Personally, I only had the blackened and fried fish tacos and a quesabirria taco, all of which I highly recommend. The tacos were stuffed to the brim and very filling. The quesabirria taco came with consumm√© for dipping and it was perfect.  Three of them filled me up and I took the last one to go. It was still delicious the next day! The atmosphere is bright and beautiful, the bathrooms were clean and easy to find, and there are bar seats with swings if you like that kind of thing. Bonus: The horchata was super cinnamony and delicious!

text: Hotel Zocalo Central was such a great experience. We went for our honeymoon and the staff welcomed us with a welcome shot of tequila and Mezcal, and the junior suite was decorated with petals, macaroons and wine. The location is perfect to move around the city, traffic is busy during the day so add time to get to whatever place you are going to, unless is walking distance then I would recommend to walk. The hotel restaurant is great! The food and view was amazing. The staff was super friendly and made us feel welcomed, the bed was very comfortable and the hotel was very clean. The area is safe, we walked around a lot and never felt nervous or unsafe. Overall we loved the hotel!

topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text: I am going to be one of the few people that does not give this a 5 star, not that its a bad thing just my opinion.    This is more of an upscale place with high end food choices and pricey drinks.  For two, we had the 4 course option, 3 drinks and glass of wine, was about 250.00 dollars.  To put that in perspective the day before for a group of 8, I spent about the same amount at cafe Tacuba.  That being said the atmosphere is great you will feel and know you are in a high end place, the minute you step off the elevator.   There will be no confusion, that you will be paying more for your meal than some Mexicans makes in almost a month (I Googled that info). As for the service it was on point. After each meal, my fork was replaced with a clean fork.  Also the views, at night from the balcony facing the Cathedral are amazing.  As for the food it was good, but I personally cannot justify the price to the portions.  If you are a regular sized guy you will, leave hungry I am 6,2 at 250 and was ready to go get me some street tacos afterward.  But of course for the ladies they were perfect portion size.  The food is good, I would not say great, and it is very much so, fancy Mexican food, or foo foo food.  Hopefully this will help you to decide if this is for you or not.
name: Gene Perez

We didn't have the chance to try the food, as the selection was gourmet, while we usually prefer experiences with more generous portions. In any case, the place is worth a visit if only for the atmosphere and the view.

address: Av. 5 de Mayo 61, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06000 Cuauht√©moc, CDMX, Mexico
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
We ordered the chefs choice menu with a group of 8. The lentil soup was cold and tasted unfortunately like boiled water with lentil and a few pieces of pork belly. No flavor. The bruschetta was not good. Bread was very hard and tasted stale. The white fish and the steak were great. Desserts were good. Got charged for an extra water of Perrier and got charged for a more expensive drink than the one I ordered. They did mess up two items but handled the situation very well. Quite frankly for the price, I would not recommend this place unless you value view over food and value. I also had a similar average experience last year where one of the main dishes was horribly over salted.

The service was always good but understaffed with servers so getting their attention is hard - not their fault. They were so polite just not enough of them.

address: 418 S Tejon St suite 100, Colorado Springs, CO 80903
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
Zocalo was recommended, and it did not disappoint. Their menu is creative and has some great twists on Mexican cuisine.

Started with the Chips & Salsa. Fresh crispy chips fresh out the fryer and very tasty salsa with a good kick. I tried several of their tacos and they were all great. Tacos I tried: Panela Mushroom, Steak Chimichurri, El Macho, Quesabirria, and Eaquites. To wet my taste buds, I had the Ancho Old Fashion. And it was delicious.

Abigail, our server, was great. Friendly and very attentive. Constantly checked in on us. Followed her suggestions, and they were great.

I recommend Zocalo to everyone.
name: Jos√© Zacar√≠as

address: 418 S Tejon St suite 100, Colorado Springs, CO 80903
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
Update 5 months later : Completely unprofessional and inappropriate sanitary standards.

Staff is serving while munching on their snacks. It's super unsanitary. And who wants a server talking to you while they're still chewing their food? Or putting the lime in their Corona, when they haven't washed their hands and just munched on chips and salsa.

The staff seemed largely distracted by consuming their own snacks/ meals any chance they got. Even my date questioned from the moment we walked in, "why is the staff eating/ chewing" he thought they were having a staff party or get together.

The chicken quesadilla we had (and had previously on a separate visit) was not as good as the previous time and served with no salsas. The Chili Rellanos were mediocre.

The entire visit was such a turn off due to the staff eating and not washing their hands.

We did speak to the manager and I expressed my concerns and even emailed the owners. This is unacceptable.

I don't recommend.

Initial review: Spunky, Delicious. NOISY.

- review based off of 2 visits 2 days apart.

a fun spot with tasty food. Only complaints the noise, and inconsistency in hours posted on the doors.

Really not cool guys- for the customers or your employees. If you close at 10- UPDATE THE DOORS.

SO HOURS ARE NOT TRUSTWORTHY!!!

You basically have to yell at the person next to you because of the music being so loud and all the other people yelling to talk.

Other than that.  Great food except for the guacamole appetizer which was bland, granted we ordered the mango and tajin on the side.

They accommodated our request for a chicken quesadilla *ZOCALO*- add it to the menu, it was one of the best chicken quesadillas! Thank you for accommodating our request.

Drinks, especially the margaritas are STRONG.

The swings look like fun and since I will return to enjoy a seat on the swings, I suppose I‚Äôd recommend them.

The service each time was impeccable as well.
name: AdvoK8great

address: 418 S Tejon St suite 100, Colorado Springs, CO 80903
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
I finally met the cook called Sergio and what a pleasure it was! He's a master at his craft, yet so humble and down to earth. Abigail took care of service today and at least once before and she's so attentive and professional. I don't remember who all I've had for servers before except for Angelo, an excellent bartender, but  every single time I come in, I'm absolutely impressed by every detail of my experience. My first visit was no more than a couple of months ago and I've visited probably 10 times since. I waited until today to write a review because I was looking for some reason to temper all this praise with at least one thing I found them lacking in, because nothing is perfect.... But Zocalo is reliably perfect. So shout out to manager Ashley, because though we haven't met, you're obviously doing things right.

I've tried several of the street tacos here and I love them all, but el pastor is #1. I've searched high and low for pastor in the Springs only to be disappointed. Zocalo is so far above the rest, it's ridiculous.

By the way, their happy hour deals are crazy, I feel like I'm stealing from them. The atmosphere is incredible, the decor is beautiful, and I'm a patron for life!
name: Zach Tytus Lyles

text:
Looks like AI wrote a business plan for a "trendy" mexican restaurant and the owner followed it to the  T. The table water was served warm in a bottle with food chunks in it. The swing chairs are pretty much impractical and poorly made (unstable due to one chain on each side). Barely give you any chips with your guacamole and even though we had a party of five they didn't even give small plates to divide up the guacamole or chips.

The food was meh. Nothing I will ever remember either good or bad.

The service was similar.  Not bad. Not good. Zero personality in the staff. Almost like they were mildly inconvenienced by having to hold a job and make money to support themselves.

Decor and ambiance are stale and a failed attempt at being cool or a vibe but it looked like they tried.

Once inside, the beauty of the castle really stood out ‚Äî from the elegant staircases to the detailed paintings and historic accessories that decorate the rooms.

What made the visit even more pleasant was that it wasn‚Äôt overly crowded, allowing for a relaxed and unhurried exploration of the space. One of the highlights was stepping out onto the terraces ‚Äî the panoramic views of Mexico City from up there are absolutely breathtaking and not to be missed.

Overall, Chapultepec Castle offers a great mix of history, art, and scenic views. A must-visit for anyone spending time in Mexico City.

address: Av. 5 de Mayo 61, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06000 Cuauht√©moc, CDMX, Mexico
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
Going up to the Z√≥calo Balcony is, from the outset, a promise: the city at your feet, the sunset gilding the Cathedral, and a chef's menu that, at least on paper, promises a sensory experience worthy of the highest standards.

And in the kitchen, it delivered.
The Lentil Soup was a warm, profound start, with flavors that seemed to come from a kitchen steeped in history. The beef fillet sope, small but powerful, struck a perfect balance between traditional and refined. The Totoaba Loin‚Äîsimply sublime‚Äîcooked to the point of perfection. And the chocolate cheesecake, elegant without being pretentious, rounded out with a wine pairing that complemented it without stealing the show. It was, without exaggeration, a first-class execution. Cuisine that walks firmly down the runway of the memorable.

But then, the service.
There, the narrative changed. Long silences. Gazes searching for someone who hadn't come. Dishes that never arrived, but were still charged for. A service pace so rushed that you doubted whether you were dining or racing against the clock. And the final irony: after the last bite, we were asked to leave a review.

So here it is:
A cuisine with vision and technique, the kind you'd recommend without a second thought. But marred by service that seemed improvised, as if a museum painting had been hung with thumbtacks.

In a place where the cuisine is top-notch, the service can't afford to be grounded. Because when you dine at the Balc√≥n del Z√≥calo, you don't just expect a meal. You expect an experience. And this time, the scales were off.

text:
Breathtaking architecture and rich artistic detail

The Metropolitan Cathedral is a true architectural masterpiece, the scale, symmetry, and craftsmanship are awe-inspiring. From the moment you step inside, you're surrounded by intricate stonework, soaring ceilings, and an overwhelming sense of history and reverence.

The interior is equally stunning, with beautifully preserved artwork, ornate altars, and the magnificent organ pipes that dominate the space. It's not just a religious site  it‚Äôs a cultural and artistic treasure that tells centuries of stories through its details.

Whether you're there for quiet reflection, admiration of the craftsmanship, or historical interest, it‚Äôs easily a  must-see when visiting Mexico City.

text:
Mexico City Metropolitan Cathedral: Jewel of the Capital's Z√≥calo
The Metropolitan Cathedral of the Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary into Heaven in Mexico City stands as one of the most emblematic and majestic monuments in Latin America, dominating the north side of the Z√≥calo or Plaza de la Constituci√≥n in the heart of Mexico City's Historic Center.
History and Construction
The history of this monumental cathedral dates back to the colonial period. After the conquest of Mexico-Tenochtitl√°n, Hern√°n Cort√©s ordered the construction of a first major church in 1524, built with stones from destroyed indigenous temples and strategically located where the four causeways leading to the Aztec spiritual center converged. However, this initial construction soon proved insufficient for the spiritual needs of the viceroyalty's capital. Construction of the current cathedral formally began in 1573, under the direction of the Spanish architect Claudio de Arciniega, who was inspired by the cathedrals of Ja√©n and Valladolid. The project represented a titanic undertaking that spanned 240 years, concluding in 1813 under the direction of architect Manuel Tols√°.
Architectural Features
The cathedral is an extraordinary compendium of architectural styles that reflects the different periods of its construction. Its main fa√ßade displays the Renaissance, Baroque, and Neoclassical styles that developed during the Viceroyalty. The dimensions of the temple are impressive: 61 meters wide by 128 meters long and 67 meters high to the top of the towers.
The interior consists of five naves with a transept, with 51 vaults, 74 arches, and 40 columns. The structure includes fourteen side chapels, each with its own character and artistic treasures. The floor is made of Tepeaca marble, and its walls and vaults are made of stone.
Artistic Treasures
Among the most notable artistic treasures is the Altar of the Kings, considered one of the masterpieces of Churrigueresque Baroque in the Americas. This magnificent work was created by Jer√≥nimo de Balb√°s between 1718 and 1725, and gilded by Francisco Mart√≠nez in 1736. The altarpiece measures 25 meters high, 13 meters wide, and 7 meters deep, and is made of carved white cedar wood covered with gold leaf. The Altar of Forgiveness, also by Jer√≥nimo de Balb√°s, is located in the central nave along with the Cathedral Choir, which features two magnificent organs. The paintings decorating the Altar of the Kings are by the prominent artist Juan Rodr√≠guez Ju√°rez, including "The Assumption of the Virgin Mary" and "The Adoration of the Magi."
The Z√≥calo: Historical Context
The cathedral is located in Constitution Square, popularly known as the Z√≥calo, which, at 46,800 square meters, is the second largest square in the world after Tiananmen Square. This square was named in honor of the C√°diz Constitution promulgated in 1812. The term "Z√≥calo" comes from the base built during the government of Antonio L√≥pez de Santa Anna to erect a commemorative column of independence. The foundation was never completed, but its base remained in place for several years. Since pre-Hispanic times, this space has been the spiritual, political, and cultural center of Mexico, serving as the setting for important historical events.
World Heritage Site
The Metropolitan Cathedral, along with the Historic Center of Mexico City, was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1987. This recognition is due to its exceptional architectural value and historical significance as a testament to the fusion of Indigenous and Spanish cultures.

If your out doing a Tejon Street bar crawl with friends or stoned, Zocalo is the perfect place for a casual dinner.

address: 418 S Tejon St suite 100, Colorado Springs, CO 80903
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text: Sergio is the owner and he serves food, talks to patrons and I can see how much his staff admire him. Everyone was happy. The staff all have good vibes and with Sergio leading, I can see he sets the tone. The food is so fresh and seasoned so perfectly. Sergio said that his recipes come from old Mexico City, very traditional. The margaritas are so delicious and they use fresh juices, no store bought mix. I had the Classico with Mezcal, instead of tequila. It comes with a sun-dried lime and has perfect balance. Not too sweet, not bitter, not too acidic, and a perfect amount of liquor. I love the refried beans-smooth, seasoned so well and a little touch of imported Mexican cheese that is nutty, and actually has flavor, as opposed to the normal bland cheese that many other restaurants serve. The Mexican rice has a hint of saffron with rich tomatoes. I usually don‚Äôt eat the rice but this rice is irresistible. I had the fajitas, the combo of steak and shrooms. The steak is smokey, with a tangy mouth-watering dose of lime. The shrooms are meaty and would make a great vegan or vegetarian meal. It comes with red peppers and onions that still have a bit of crunch. The chips are perfectly cooked, crisp and seasoned. They come in a brown paper bag and if your lucky, they may be right out of the fryer. The ambiance is fun and they have swings to sit on. The kids will love this and so do the adults. The music is also great. Sergio wanted me to try the birria taco and gave me one for free. So damn good. He also gave me some tamales to take home. He told me he likes to keep his prices reasonable and they are. Do yourself a favor, and eat there. I promise, you will leave happy. I can‚Äôt remember any restaurant owner giving free food, sitting at your table to talk about where you are from and expressing gratitude for dining at their establishment. Times have changed, but at Zocalo, you feel valued and to me, that means so much.
name: Susan Cooper

topic: hotel, location, view, staff, great, breakfast, stay, loved, rooms, pleasant
text: The hotel was chosen by the tour operator we used, and I must say we were extremely satisfied! It's a pleasant stay here, the staff is friendly, and the location is enviable, practically overlooking Mexico City's main square. The panoramic terrace on the sixth floor where breakfast is served is truly enviable and unique. Like all roses, this beautiful property also has its thorns. Being in the center, it's a bit noisy, with frequent alarms and disturbing noises at night. Breakfast is plentiful, but many dishes are √† la carte, so you have to request them on the spot. I personally prefer rich buffets and not having to constantly ask. The service staff could use a review. At 8:15, they knock on your door and ask if the room is free for cleaning. In any case, highly recommended. I hope to return one day for the Day of the Dead! üòÄ

topic: place, wonderful, visit, castle, great, time, lots, awesome, day, go
text:
It stands out primarily for its unforgettable setting, where the atmosphere becomes the true star.
Its privileged view is worth it. From the restaurant, you can enjoy an incomparable perspective of the Z√≥calo and its buildings. The decor complements this view, creating an elegant and welcoming atmosphere.
In addition to the setting, the service is outstanding. The staff is attentive and professional, contributing significantly to a smooth and pleasant experience. The combination of the view, the decor, and the impeccable service elevates the visit to a level that justifies choosing this place.
The food is good, though not extraordinary. While the dishes are of a high quality, they remain average. However, the drinks offer some very interesting points: we loved the homemade Tepache. We also tried a sparkling white wine from Quer√©taro and some mezcals, all of which were excellent complements to the occasion.

You can find something different around every corner: from iconic monuments like the Palace of Fine Arts and the Angel of Independence, to bohemian neighborhoods like Roma and Condesa. I loved exploring Paseo de la Reforma on the hop-on hop-off bus, trying the delicious local cuisine, and enjoying natural spaces like Xochimilco. Without a doubt, it's a destination that offers an unforgettable experience and is worth visiting more than once.

We ordered chips & salsa for $6.50 as you don't get any without ordering & paying for it. I'd say the salsa was delicious. We didn't order any drinks, just water. The water wasn't cold, no ice & we were given these little tin cups. Overall, I was disappointed and won't be returning. Save yourself $ and get your quesabirria tacos at Monica's instead. You get 3 giant tacos & a big cup of consome for $12.

topic: place, wonderful, visit, castle, great, time, lots, awesome, day, go
text:
The menu includes a four-course meal, which includes an appetizer, a corn-based snack, the main course, and dessert. There are three options for each course, and you can combine them, which I think is an excellent idea.

The price of the menu depends on the choice of main course, ranging from approximately 850 to 1,300. It's worth noting that drinks are separate.

The dishes are beautifully presented and the portions adequate. Although the appetizer and snack are small, the main course is enough to satisfy.

The view of downtown Mexico City, which allows you to see the Z√≥calo, and therefore the National Palace and the Mexico City government building, as well as the cathedral, is worth it.

address: Av. 5 de Mayo 61, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06000 Cuauht√©moc, CDMX, Mexico
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
Balc√≥n del Z√≥calo is a contemporary Mexican restaurant.
We arrived shortly after breakfast; their lunch service starts at 1 p.m. Their menu includes sharing dishes priced from $600 to $800.
But since we were hungry, we decided to choose the four-course menu, priced per person from $890 to $1,200, depending on the main course.
We tried clam ceviche, tortilla soup, tacos, and the exquisite fish loin and steak.
If you're a wine lover, they offer wines by the glass starting at $250 or $1,200 by the bottle.
The view of the cathedral is perfect from tables near the railing.
We also liked the cocktails (gins).
Definitely a place to enjoy in every way.
We hope to return soon to try their breakfast buffet.

address: 418 S Tejon St suite 100, Colorado Springs, CO 80903
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
We went here with some friends for lunch. Solid place! Not the best tacos I‚Äôve ever had (pastor and a beef taco) but not the worst. Solid 7/10. Out favorite thing was the atmosphere and the open space and lighting.
It just seems like they‚Äôre getting their feet set with learning how to run a restaurant well? With service not being very quick or professional. Nice people, though. My biggest disappointment was that when the waiter went around to give people their digital bills, he did not say that there was a group fee (20% for our group of only 8) and all I saw on the screen was the total. So I of course added a tip and paid. Thought the price seemed a little high so I sent myself a receipt and then found out about the group tip already added. The whole table ended up tipping twice.
I hope it was just an oversight on his end. But either way, not very professional as a server. Or more so as the restaurant for not training their servers to communicate this up front to their customers/guests.
name: Ian Prince

address: 418 S Tejon St suite 100, Colorado Springs, CO 80903
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
Some positives:

The happy hour pricing is great, so sometimes we go for happy hour. The $3 tacos are very, very generously-sized for the price, and the chips+salsa are good. I often order grilled fish tacos, which are generally tasty and very filling. For non-HH dining, there are lots of options for carnivores to vegans and most things are intrinsically gluten free. It's nice to have a menu that is geared slightly more toward southern Mexico. The margaritas are done well and the beer selection is appropriate to the venue.

However, there are some pretty consistent issues:

The place smells intensely of the fryer. If you wear a jacket in, it will still smell awful a few days later. Not subtly either; the people around you will notice how awful you smell. This has been the case since they opened, and it's the primary reason we take breaks from Zocalo.

Certain food items are a little rough. The fried fish is grey and slimy and unpleasant to eat. The carne asada is grey and bland. Food items have come out with small mistakes regularly, such as missing salsa or a taco that was never garnished at all.

The beer is sometimes flat. I think there's a bit of a line pressure issue that a distributor could solve.

The range in quality of service is from awful to pretty good, with no clear indication of why it's sometimes so bad. We're often ignored for too long/indefinitely, or the order is taken wrong, or there's an issue with the check (or the gratuity entered at the end of the shift). Sometimes they are understaffed but we've noticed the same problems when they are heavily staffed.

Overall, the issues aren't enough to totally take away our desire to eat there occasionally, especially given happy hour pricing, but solving those issues would greatly enhance the experience.
name: Andrew Combs (Shepherd)

address: 418 S Tejon St suite 100, Colorado Springs, CO 80903
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
The service at this restaurant was one of the worst I‚Äôve experienced in a long time. The fact that it took 10 minutes for the waitress to bring chips and salsa should‚Äôve been a warning for what was to come. We had chips and salsa that sat empty for 20 minutes. We also had our water bottle empty for well over 20 mins needing a refill. We looked all over for her to ask for a refill but did not see her for a while. Eventually she passed us after giving another table chips and salsa and still did not refill our chips or water. We continued to wait 30-40 minutes for our food, which for 2 people, is pretty excessive, we‚Äôre assuming she forgot to put in our order. Over that span of time we saw her maybe 2 times. She eventually came over when we flagged her down and she asked to refill the salsa. She came back with only the salsa and forgot the chips. She came back and said the chips were out and they were refrying them. When our food came finally came out she forgot both of our tacos and had to go back and get them. Then about 20 mins later after promising chips, she returned, but we were already finishing up. We waited another 15 minutes waiting for our check which never came so we had to go to the bar and ask them to get our waitress.

Overall, terrible service. Waitress will ignore and neglect you. The food isn‚Äôt bad but for the service and time it takes to receive your food, you‚Äôre better off eating elsewhere. I‚Äôd only recommend if you‚Äôre in a pinch for places open, not if you‚Äôre in a pinch for time. This would be the worst place to go if you‚Äôre in a pinch for time.

Balc√≥n del Z√≥calo offers an exceptional dining experience primarily defined by its unrivaled views of Mexico City's historic Z√≥calo, including the Metropolitan Cathedral and National Palace. Securing a balcony table, provides a truly spectacular backdrop.

The cuisine is modern Mexican, characterized by creative interpretations of traditional dishes and a strong emphasis on high-quality ingredients. Plates are elegantly presented, reflecting a fine-dining approach without being overly formal.

text: Don't come to this place unless you want to have a terrible experience. I came to this restaurant because it was offered to my friends and I when we were walking around the historic center, but we didn't know we were going to get ripped off. It took a long time to bring our orders. We ordered three drinks and some appetizers (nachos with cheese and guacamole with moles), and the moles were runny, the guacamole was old, the cheese was awful, and the nachos were watery. When we asked the waitress if she could take the appetizers away, she said yes, and when it was time to pay, they charged us for everything. We tried to come to an agreement, but the waitress refused. Also, when we asked about the bill, she said there was a 16% surcharge for the restaurant area, and that was never mentioned when we were served. Terrible service, terrible food, I do not recommend it.

text:
I think this would be a nice place for drinks with friends, especially in summer when they can open those windows. Atmosphere was fresh and modern.
Menu is mostly a la carte, just to let you know in case you are not into that.
Our server was very nice. Neither of us received what we had ordered but no big deal, we are not picky. Still interesting that it happened to both of us.
Overall, the flavor of the food was just okay. Nothing to write home about, crave a week from now, or go tell all our friends about.
I would come back to try the drinks, maybe hang out in the evening with friend. I would not come back because I craved Mexican food, I would definitely look elsewhere for that.

topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text: I‚Äôm new to town and was looking for a Mexican food place with good chow and fun ambiance for a Saturday night. Look no further mi amigos! This place is swingin (pun intended - the bar swing seats are great for the kids). The horchata is so creamy and the sprinkled cinnamon adds a nice touch. Little weird to see a charge for chips and salsa, but after having them I‚Äôd gladly try again (next time with guac!) - they were crispy, lightly oiled, and salty. Kids had the enchiladas - they went with server Katie‚Äôs recommendation of beef with red sauce and chicken with green. These meals come with rice and beans, but tacos do not. My wife and I had the tacos, which did not disappoint - the carne asada is bigger than normal but is delicious. I also tried the quesabirria and shrimp, also good (although the shrimp was breaded and I prefer grilled). The highlight of the night was when I asked for spicier salsa. Katie went back and asked Sergio if they had any and he just whipped me up a phenomenal chili diarbo, Serrano, habenero salsa. He came out to check on us and insisted we try the salsa in the el macho - pretty fantastic as well! Overall everything we were looking for a weekend out - definitely a place I‚Äôll be bringing family back to!
name: Brandon Schlecht

address: Z√≥calo, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06060 Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX, Mexico
topic: beautiful, cathedral, history, incredible, many, architecture, mexico, impressive, full, place
text:
The Historic Center of Mexico City is a fascinating place that encapsulates centuries of history, culture and architecture. Walking through its streets is like taking a trip back in time, where each corner reveals a part of the rich heritage of the Mexican capital.

One of the main attractions is the Z√≥calo, one of the largest squares in the world, surrounded by impressive buildings such as the Metropolitan Cathedral and the National Palace, which houses the famous murals by Diego Rivera. These sites offer an in-depth look at the history and art of Mexico.

The Templo Mayor, located just steps from the Z√≥calo, is another highlight. The Aztec ruins and adjacent museum allow visitors to explore the city's pre-Hispanic past. As one ventures deeper into the Historic Center, one finds streets full of life, vibrant markets, and a variety of shops and restaurants offering everything from traditional crafts to delicious Mexican food.

The Historic Center is also home to important museums, such as the Museo del Palacio de Bellas Artes, known for its impressive Art Nouveau architecture and interior murals, and the Casa de los Azulejos, with its facade covered in Talavera tiles. The mix of colonial, modern and pre-Hispanic buildings creates a unique and charming urban landscape.

Visiting the Historic Center of Mexico City is an enriching experience that offers something for everyone: history, culture, art, gastronomy and vibrant urban life. It is a place where the past and present coexist harmoniously, inviting visitors to explore and discover the essence of Mexico City.

text:
We had an incredible experience at Balc√≥n.

Here‚Äôs what we loved:
- Phenomenal service: due to the teacher protest we were late for our reservation but they waited patiently for us to arrive; waitstaff was always helpful, quick to refill water/drinks and never skipped a beat with our questions about the menu.
- drinks were unique and exceptionally tasty
- views of Plaza de Constituti√≥n and the buildings were incredible.
- food was top notch!  Our group chose to do the pick 3 option on the menu: Tirana ceviche, shrimp taco, filet taco, octopus, tlacoyo tacos, totoaba filet on mole, heirloom tomato salad, rib-eye, everything was absolutely delicious!
- perfect portion-size
- never felt rushed to finish an item
- heaters were flanking our table which helped as the temperature cooled outside.

Things I would change if we could:
- our choices of clothing! We were right at the front of the balcony which was fantastic for the amazing views but it was quite windy. I would have worn nice pants and brought a thicker sweater.
- prepare for a lot of traffic getting there especially if there is a protest going on (we had to walk the last few blocks due to road closures associated with the teachers‚Äô protest).

text: Mexico City's Historic Center is a must-see if you're visiting. It has recently been closed to vehicles, which makes the area's architectural beauty even more appreciated. You can get there by car; there are several parking lots in the surrounding area, and you can also easily take the metro by getting off at the Bellas Artes, Allende, or Z√≥calo stations. Clothing stores, jewelry stores, opticians with very affordable prices, currency exchange centers, restaurants, museums, places to find books at good prices, the Torre Latinoamericana, and countless accessory stores‚Äîyou're sure to find whatever you're looking for. There are wheelchair-accessible spaces and establishments with public restrooms. Bellas Artes, the Alameda, the Museum of Memory and Tolerance, the National Museum of Art, etc.‚Äîa weekend is definitely not enough.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Z√≥calo Central Hotel in Mexico City, and I truly enjoyed my stay. From the moment I arrived, the staff was incredibly welcoming and attentive, making me feel right at home.

One of the highlights of my stay was the breakfast. The variety and quality of the food were exceptional, with a delightful selection of fresh fruits, pastries, and traditional Mexican dishes. The dining area also offered a stunning view of the Z√≥calo, making breakfast even more enjoyable.Also appreciate the 24/7 cafe service staff excellent service

The room was comfortable, clean, and well-appointed, providing a perfect retreat after a day of exploring the city. The hotel‚Äôs central location made it easy to visit many of Mexico City‚Äôs top attractions, and the staff was always ready with helpful recommendations.

Overall, Z√≥calo Central Hotel exceeded my expectations in every way. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Mexico City, and I look forward to staying there again on my next trip.

text: The center of Mexico City is a fairly large square, its buildings hold the history of the Mexican nation. On the square stands the flagpole where the flag, symbol of the Mexican nation, waves. The area is always very clean. The floor has just been renovated. In its surroundings, you will find the best museums in this city. text:
I honestly expected more from the food. I know the portions are small to enhance the flavor. The bad thing was that they weren't.

Well, for the first course, it was a salad, you could say like a caprese salad with strawberries. The strawberries were half overcooked, the tomato ball was too hard for my taste, and the pesto was delicious. The presentation was amazing.
For the second course, a tlacoyo, to be honest, was unbelievable, delicious, I would go back just for that dish.
For the third course, I think it was a sea bass loin. It was supposed to be juicy, unfortunately, it came out dry, I think it was overcooked or overcooked in the pan.
For the last course, I don't quite remember what its name was, like a chocolate volcano cake, but it was rectangular. Honestly, it stung me. I don't know if it had too much cinnamon or another ingredient that I can't really identify.
I would go back, maybe, but in the future.

address: Av. 5 de Mayo 61, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06000 Cuauht√©moc, CDMX, Mexico
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
DO NOT EAT HERE ‚Äî They will steal from you and ignore you.

I had a very frustrating and disappointing experience at Balcon de Zocalo in Mexico City. While the food and views were beautiful, our visit was ultimately ruined by dishonesty and terrible customer service.

Last year, I went with a friend who attempted to pay with his Capital One card. The first card didn‚Äôt work, so he tried a second one, which also didn‚Äôt go through. When he went back to the first card, it finally worked. The staff assured us that the failed transactions were voided and would not be charged.

That turned out to be false. Both ‚Äúvoided‚Äù transactions went through, and we were charged multiple times for one meal. We‚Äôve been trying to get our money back since June of last year, and despite countless emails and calls, we‚Äôve gotten nothing but empty promises. We even had a Spanish-speaking friend from El Salvador call on our behalf, and they hung up on her. That kind of behavior strongly suggests a lack of honesty and integrity.

We‚Äôve also reached out repeatedly on Instagram and Facebook for almost a year‚Äîagain, no resolution. All we‚Äôve asked for is a simple receipt to prove to Capital One that the duplicate charges were fraudulent, and they refuse to provide even that.

It's deeply upsetting to be out hundreds of dollars after being told we wouldn‚Äôt be charged. As tourists, we expected more from a place as prominent as Balcon de Zocalo. If you're an American or international visitor, avoid paying by card here‚Äîyour money may not be safe.

What could have been a lovely experience turned into a nightmare. It's a shame that such a well-known establishment would operate in this way. Be warned
name: Hilda Dwumfuor

topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text: I'd been there before, but I didn't like it this time; I'll delete it from my list. As for the menu, you must have all three courses. The flavor wasn't spectacular, but it lacked something extra, a more sophisticated flavor for the concept I believe they're proposing. The dishes were very cheesy and overpriced for the price. The mole had no mole at all, the octopus was undercooked, the dessert was spicy, and the risotto was tough and flavorless; the cheese overpowered any subtlety of the dish. The drinks were warm, the tequila was very expensive! The carajillo was cheesy. The atmosphere was awful; the music was lacking in style, and it was too hot. We asked them to open the sunroof several times, but they didn't. And the service was lackluster. I never even knew who my server was. Finally, the chicken breast they made for my children tasted terrible; it's not kid-friendly, and there were plenty of them. The sauces were bland. And to top it all off, the street was closed due to a protest.

topic: hotel, location, view, staff, great, breakfast, stay, loved, rooms, pleasant
text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for a 3-night stay, and I must say it was an excellent experience from start to finish.

Firstly, the check-in process was smooth and efficient. The staff at the front desk were friendly, welcoming, and knowledgeable. They provided all the necessary information about the hotel amenities and made me feel valued as a guest.

The room itself was spacious, clean, and well-appointed. The bed was comfortable, ensuring a good night's sleep after a long day of exploring the city. The bathroom was also spotless and stocked with high-quality toiletries.

One of the highlights of my stay was the hotel's dining options. The breakfast buffet offered a wide variety of delicious options, from fresh fruits and pastries to hot cooked dishes. In addition, they offered a free menu at the restaurant (soups, salads, sadwiches, snacks, soft drinks, frozen drinks and beer) The restaurant staff were attentive and accommodating, making sure that all guests were well taken care of.

The hotel's location was also ideal for exploring the city. It was conveniently located near popular attractions and public transportation options, making it easy to get around. Additionally, the hotel provided helpful recommendations for nearby restaurants and activities.

Last but not least, the service at this hotel was top-notch. The staff went above and beyond to ensure that my stay was enjoyable and hassle-free. From housekeeping to the concierge, everyone was professional, friendly, and always ready to assist with any requests or inquiries.

Overall, my 3-night stay at this hotel was truly excellent. The combination of outstanding service, comfortable accommodations, delicious and free dining options, and convenient location made for an unforgettable experience. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a memorable stay in the area.

text: One of the best hotel services we've ever had. The location is wonderful, and the room is comfortable and well-suited to our needs. It's close to several interesting places within walking distance. Besides the rooftop restaurant, there are many restaurants nearby. They offer a free guided walking tour (Spanish/English), which we took and loved. Oh, and it's worth mentioning the 24-hour caf√© on the ground floor, open to guests, with breads, sandwiches, pastries, and a variety of delicious treats. We can't forget to mention the excellent service we received from everyone, but especially from concierges Michele and Salvador, who were incredibly helpful with our city tours, including money-saving and safety tips. Michele sent us gifts, wine, and treats to our room and was always available to help us every day of our stay. We will definitely stay at Zocalo Central again!

text:
Hands Down Best Tacos In Colorado Springs

My wife and I have been going to Zocalo for the past 9 months and it has quickly become one of our favorite spots in the Springs.  We love the food and their drink menu is spectacular but I think the part we like most is the staff and owner.  It‚Äôs rare, especially in today‚Äôs day and age, to go to the same restaurant and see the same staff over a long period of time and I think the fact that we see the same familiar faces each time we go in speaks volumes to the atmosphere and the vibe going on there.  The staff and bartenders are friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable and the owner is so humble and easy going.

Going back to the food, my wife and I love street tacos and have been to just about every spot in the Springs and we both agree Zocalo is our favorite.  The El Macho and Quesabirria are my favorite and my wife, as a pescatarian, loves the fact that she has so many options there (her favorite is the Equites)‚Ä¶ and if you‚Äôre there on the weekend don‚Äôt miss out on the Poke Nachos.  Their drink menu also has a lot of unique cocktails on it and we appreciate that all the drinks are made with real ingredients (no sour mix here).  The El Jefe and Mezcal Sour are great drinks but we find ourselves going back to the Mexican Blood and Sand more times than not.

I honestly can‚Äôt say enough good things about this place, we initially went for the food and drink but find ourselves coming back over and over again for the vibe and the people.  There‚Äôs something special going on here and I‚Äôm just happy to be a small part of it.

topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text: Fun taco place in downtown COS.   No matter what your appetite, this place will have a well constructed, yummy taco for you.   From traditional carnitas, to sweet and spicy el pastor, to lengua and beef cheek these made to order tacos are top of the line delish. There are even seafood and veggies options available.   They also serve house made salsa (just the right balance of heat and heavy on the cilantro), queso, an sauces made to go with the tacos.  Fun place to head for a group gathering or needing to lift your spirits after a long grueling day.   During happy hour M-Thurs the tacos of the day are half priced just an FYI.

address: P.za de la Constituci√≥n S/N, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06000 Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX, Mexico
topic: beautiful, cathedral, history, incredible, many, architecture, mexico, impressive, full, place
text:
A unique experience that blends history, culture, and urban life

I recently visited Mexico City's Historic Center, and the experience was much more than a sightseeing tour: it was a journey through time and the many identities that coexist here. From the moment you arrive, it's impossible not to feel the weight of history and the vibrant energy that surrounds it.

This is where you'll find some of the country's most iconic sites, such as the Z√≥calo, the Metropolitan Cathedral, the National Palace, and the Templo Mayor. Everything is close by and easy to explore on foot. Every corner has something to tell: stunning architecture, street art, traditional sounds like organ grinders, and the comings and goings of people that keep everything moving.

What surprised me most was the mix of old and new. You can see colonial buildings alongside modern shops, interactive museums, galleries, restaurants, and charming cafes. I highly recommend visiting the Palacio de Bellas Artes (both inside and out) and the Casa de los Azulejos. There are also many museums for those who enjoy art and history, such as the MUNAL (Mexican Museum of Art and History) and the Templo Mayor Museum.

The food is also excellent. From street vendors selling tacos, tlacoyos, and ice creams to places serving more elaborate traditional Mexican food, there are options for all budgets.

Of course, as in any urban center, you should be careful with your belongings and avoid lonely streets at night. Security has improved significantly, and there is police presence in the busiest areas, but it's always a good idea to proceed with caution.
name: David Sanchez

text:
The Metropolitan Cathedral, a monumental presence in Mexico City's Z√≥calo, is a breathtaking testament to centuries of architectural evolution and artistic devotion. Its fa√ßade alone is a symphony of styles, a living chronicle etched in stone, spanning from the restrained austerity of its early Renaissance foundations to the exuberant flourish of its Baroque and Neoclassical embellishments. Twin bell towers pierce the sky, their intricate carvings and statuary reaching towards the heavens, while the central dome, a masterful feat of engineering, crowns the edifice with majestic grace.
Within, the grandeur continues. Soaring vaulted ceilings draw the eye upward, supported by massive columns that create a sense of profound scale. Sunlight, filtered through stained-glass windows, casts a kaleidoscope of colors across polished floors and gilded altarpieces, illuminating the rich tapestry of religious art. Every chapel, every corner, reveals meticulous craftsmanship: elaborate Churrigueresque retablos shimmering with gold leaf, delicate Rococo details whispering tales of devotion, and solemn Neoclassical forms exuding an air of dignified reverence. The sheer ambition, the fusion of diverse aesthetics, and the enduring quality of its construction make the Metropolitan Cathedral a truly awe-inspiring marvel of human ingenuity and spiritual expression.
name: Bob Sacamano

address: Av. 5 de Mayo 61, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06000 Cuauht√©moc, CDMX, Mexico
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
Perfect meal and experience! We came for a 7:15 reservation and was able to be sat a bit before, which was perfect to see the sunset. I had the tepache and my girlfriend had the pornstar martini. We shared the blanco loco. The tepache was perfect- not too sweet and the mezcal smoky flavor held strong. The pornstar martini was nice, the maracuya flavor was prominent, but we wished there was more vanilla flavor. The blanco loco is sweet but delicious and an interesting texture.

We shared the four course menu and chose: the oysters, the crab taco, the beef mole and the chocolate cake. We were not very hungry so it was the perfect amount for the both of us. The oysters had many different textures which was interesting, but a bit overwhelming on the palette. I believe it contained miso glaze, but could not taste the umami flavor. The crab taco was lovely. A nice blend of textures (crunchy fried crab, onions and aioli) and flavors (avocado, lime and sweet crab). The star of the show was definitely the beef. Perfectly cooked, it tasted like butter and a wonderful mole sauce. The chicharr√≥n balls and asparagus/brussel sprouts made for some interesting texture and flavor combinations. The chocolate cake dessert was light, creamy and buttery. Our waiter, Fabian, was very attentive and gave us great recommendations. When hearing of my girlfriend‚Äôs dairy allergy, they made sure to give us salsa with our bread instead of butter so she could enjoy. Highly recommend for a memorable experience.

text:
Amazing ambiance, exceptional service, and breathtaking views. Balc√≥n del Z√≥calo is truly a gem! From the moment you step in, you can tell they take serious pride in every detail. The decor is stunning. We just went for drinks and they took care of us (other places nearby are stuffy and force everyone to buy an entree for you to buy a drink). We tried the cocktails Sandia, Loco Blanco, Godfather. All three were great.

The service was impeccable‚Äîattentive, friendly, without hovering. Everyone was pleasant. The view is unforgettable. Overlooking the Z√≥calo at night is magical and adds an extra layer of charm to the whole experience.

I can‚Äôt wait to come back to enjoy everything Balc√≥n del Z√≥calo has to offer again. Highly recommend it for a special evening out or just treating yourself to a fantastic meal and drinks!

---

text: Newer taco restaurant  on Tejon just north of Cimarron. The restaurant is big and has a nice relaxed atmosphere. I did not get to dine in, but sat at the bar while waiting for my order. I watch the bartenders make margaritas and they looked great, unfortunately, I had to drive home so didn't try any.  The menu has a large variety of tacos to choose from.  I ordered 6 different tacos to go (since it was my first time trying them, I wanted to sample as many as possible).  The tacos transported well and were quite tasty. I am sure eating them at the restaurant would have been a far better experience. I also ordered the churros.  They transported well, were still pretty warm with a nice chewy interior and a crispy exterior.  I will definitely be going back.
