address: 418 S Tejon St suite 100, Colorado Springs, CO 80903
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
I was very disappointed from my experience. I have thought about my review for two months.

The initial complication started with the order to order a taco. I had questions. She didn't understand my simple questions about the ingredients of the specific tacos I was inquiring about (the vegetarian options). Ultimately, I wanted to know what the ingredients were and if it was free of animal products. My friend and I were able to decipher that she didn't know. When she came back to bring my friend's queso, and to take her order, I had a couple more questions about customizing my order. The server just couldn't comprehend. I tried four times to ask my questions. To restate my questions. Rephrase my questions and then I thought maybe I am not speaking well enough. So, my friend, who's a very articulate and great at projecting rephrased and reframe exactly what I was asking. No, there was not a a language barrier.

The request was to remove one ingredient from a taco. Or option 2, was was to apply the Portabella mushroom  mushroom to a different taco as the protein. It blew her mind. Following the conversation about customizing the taco I just gave up.  She went to go ask somebody in the kitchen. I don't even think she knew what she was asking. Even if she asked. While she was away, I asked my friend if I was not speaking clearly, or how I could've worded that more clearly and more understandable. She said, I think you were very clear.

The server returned. I wanted to make this a simple for everybody.  I will order the portobello taco with no cheese or creama. When the food arrived. Of course, there was creama on the taco. Yet the cheese was not present. Close, but still deadly. They remade the taco.

My incomprehensible request was the CAMOTE AL PASTOR taco with the Portabella mushroom added as a protein. That's all.

I ended up with the PANELA MUSHROOM, no cheese and creama.

While are they prepared our tacos, I noticed the water glass had red lipstick on it. As a result, I took a closer look. It was unwashed. Completely. Fingerprints and all. At this point I drank almost half of the water. Note, the server was very gracious, embarrassed and apologetic. They replaced my right away. Yes this can happen. It's disgusting. I'm not sure how it happened. At this point, I was really hopeful that the food redeem this place. Because the ambience was great, aside from the loud music.

When the mushroom taco arrived, it was simply a mushroom, with sauce, arugula on a tortilla. I asked for a side of avocado slices. She brings me smashed avocado, which they call guacamole. Which is OK. I just needed something to add flavor and a little more value to my taco. The flavor didn't change much. And I love avocado.

They did not charge me for the Avocado/guacamole due to the dirty water glass. That's very much appreciated. And I want to acknowledge that.

What's a taco good? No. Was it filling? No. It was lacking density and flavor. Also substance. I would love to have ordered more, but I was not going to even try based on the in accuracy and the lack of flavor or taste. I just left hungry.

My friend did enjoy her chips and queso. Her toco was "okay" as it lacked flavor. I don't recall which taco she ordered but it was an animal protein taco.

That taco isn't worth of five dollars. That taco isn't worth $1.50.

You will leave smelling like tacos. My coworkers new I had tacos for lunch. From two offices from away, he smelled me and my clothes. It's not a bad smell, but in a modern restaurant I don't think I should smell like a taco shop..

I do not recommend this place. I have no plans of going back. Many other people have had a very different experiences than I.

I don't understand, due to the computer in her hand, and from her knowledge, she could not request that the Portabella mushroom be added to a taco.  Perhaps the training gap. But also, you can add a note that says side of Portabella mushroom. Or place Portabella mushroom on this taco. No effort.
name: K Dub

The carne asada was bland ground beef, carnitas, and shrimp were disappointing. The mushroom and esquites tacos were not bad. The quesabirria taco had almost no consume and did not have any meat in it... I heard the fried beef was really good but couldn't try it due to a gluten allergy. Most of the menu is gluten free which is awesome, but overall was underwhelmed by the food. Service was also a let down--our server was friendly but MIA most of the day. address: Av. 5 de Mayo 61, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06000 Cuauht√©moc, CDMX, Mexico
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
One Star. Great View, Terrible Food

We were excited to try Balc√≥n del Z√≥calo based on the views and the buzz online, but this turned out to be one of the worst dining experiences we‚Äôve had in Mexico City.

The space itself is beautiful, and the staff were friendly when we arrived, but unfortunately that‚Äôs where the positives end. The food was a major letdown, and that‚Äôs putting it lightly. Even for a group of adventurous eaters, the flavor combinations were strange and didn‚Äôt work. A standout oddity: no real butter, just a strange coffee butter. But the real issue came with the steak.

One of our dishes came out completely raw, not rare or even medium-rare. raw. We sent it back immediately, and instead of correcting the issue, they simply removed the plate‚Ä¶ and still charged us full price. No apology, no attempt to make it right.

To make matters worse, we had come specifically because we saw guacamole promoted online only to be told they didn‚Äôt serve it anymore.

We even spoke with other diners who were equally disappointed with their meals.

Bottom line: go for the view if you must, but skip the food. There are so many incredible dining options in CDMX. this is not one of them.
name: Angelica Tai

text:
A great museum! You can read a lot about Frida's life, in English and Spanish. Sometimes there's a painting studio. The galleries are well organized, and there's also a room with Frida's dresses and sashes.
Tickets are available online and can be purchased a month in advance. In other words, in January you can buy tickets for January and February; in February you can buy tickets for February and March, etc. Tickets sell out quickly, so I recommend buying as far in advance as possible. There is a discount for nationals.

I love Zocalo! The food is dynamite, the service is friendly and fast, and the vibe inside is so cool.

The tacos de la calle are all incredible, but the brisket quesadilla steals the show for me. You can smell it come out from the kitchen, and it is such a great blend of smokey and savory and flavorful.

I wish I could give Zocalo 10 stars out of 5. You won't be disappointed here.

address: P.za de la Constituci√≥n S/N, Centro Hist√≥rico de la Cdad. de M√©xico, Centro, Cuauht√©moc, 06010 Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX, Mexico
topic: beautiful, cathedral, history, incredible, many, architecture, mexico, impressive, full, place
text:
Constitution Square, also known as the Z√≥calo, is an iconic location in the heart of Mexico City. With a rich history spanning from pre-Hispanic times to the present day, this plaza is a reflection of Mexican national identity.

*History and Significance*

- In pre-Hispanic times, the Z√≥calo was part of the Templo Mayor, an important ceremonial center of the Aztecs.
- After the Spanish conquest, the Plaza Mayor was built, which became the political and religious center of the city.
- In 1813, it was officially named Plaza de la Constituci√≥n in honor of the Constitution of C√°diz.
- The name "Z√≥calo" comes from an unfinished project by Antonio L√≥pez de Santa Anna to build a monument to Independence in the center of the square. Only the base, or z√≥calo, was placed, and it remained in place for years.

*Buildings and Monuments*

- *Metropolitan Cathedral*: one of the city's most important churches, built on the ruins of the Aztec Templo Mayor.
- *National Palace*: seat of the federal executive branch, built on the site of Moctezuma's palace.
- *Templo Mayor*: an archaeological site and museum housing the remains of the Aztec civilization.
- *City Hall*: seat of the Mexico City government.

*Current Issues*

- The presence of street vendors in the plaza is a controversial issue, as some believe it affects the aesthetics and functionality of the public space.

In short, the Plaza de la Constituci√≥n is an iconic place that reflects Mexico's rich history and culture. Although it faces current challenges, it remains an important political, religious, and cultural center of the city.
name: Ricardo Zorraquin Cornejo

I am the first advocate for buying and supporting local, but this is NOT! This system only benefits Booking Viator and other third parties. So, until they update that and allow for walk ins. address: Londres 247, Del Carmen, Coyoac√°n, 04100 Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX, Mexico
topic: nice, great, amazing, place, food, toronto, views, tacos, good, view
text: The Frida Kahlo Museum is one of those rare places that leaves you a little changed after visiting. It is not just a museum but the actual home where she lived, created, and endured her setbacks and triumphs. Walking through her rooms and seeing her studio with the brushes still at hand makes you feel as though she just stepped out for a moment. The experience is intimate and moving in a way that no traditional gallery can be because you are not only seeing her art, you are standing in the space where her life unfolded. The exhibits take you through her hardships and resilience, showing how every piece she created was born out of pain, strength, and an almost defiant creativity. The gardens are another highlight, lush and vibrant, a sanctuary that contrasts with the intensity of her story yet feels like a natural extension of her artistry. The tour is well done, guiding you through her world with just enough explanation to deepen the experience without overshadowing it. This is easily a five star cultural destination in Mexico City, worth every minute, and one of those places you carry with you long after leaving.
name: Paul Mark Morris

text:
We had reservations and seated immediately. The restaurant was full on a Saturday. Fabian was our waiter and he was wonderful.  We were seated at the balcony edge. It is a bit chilly and people take photos there to look over the plaza but we did not care
The food here was the best we have had and great value.
We started with wine all from Mexico. Choices limited however we were happy with our choices. Next we had the salad with bacon and spiced nuts. Tacos we had the fish and octopus. Fish was better. Next steak and fish. The steak was perfectly cooked and the mustard sauce was a perfect compliment.  The fish was very good but the steak was better.  Lastly we had a slight communication lapse where I got the almond ice cream and cream cone and my daughter got the sorbet.  She is gluten free and we thought we ordered two sorbets but it was fine   We just did nit share that item.  They also brought gluten free crackers instead of bread.  Very accommodating.
The views were beautiful at sunset the food was delicious the service great.  I would definitely recommend

address: Av. Don Juan de Palafox y. Mendoza, Centro hist√≥rico de Puebla, 72000 Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Pue., Mexico
topic: place, wonderful, visit, castle, great, time, lots, awesome, day, go
text: Oh no, what can I say about my beautiful Puebla, which has given me everything and has also given me everything. It's certainly not a perfect city‚Äîno city is‚Äîbut the magic of my city lies in the collision of antiquity with modernity. Quality of life and sustainable living, spectacular climate, and a historic center carved by Mexicans, hundreds of beautiful buildings that, like silent witnesses, have stood before the entire conquest and colonial era of our country. That energy is perceived, felt, and moves me. I am proudly from Puebla. There are undoubtedly shortcomings, but Puebla has a big heart and a mystical energy. Everyone is welcome. Walk around the main square and the surrounding area, eat a lot, take photos, visit the museums and wonders of the world, enjoy the weather, contemplate the volcanoes, enjoy the culture and avant-garde. Just return to your cities after your visit, because there are already so many of us, hehe. Enjoy!

topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text: Frida Kahlo was a world renowned Mexican artist. This museum is actually in the house where she lived until she passed away. The museum displays some of her works along with a history of her life. A lot of the rooms are left just the way they were while she was living there. She had polio in her childhood and then she had a tragic accident while riding a school bus when a tram crashed into her. She suffered multiple fractures in her hip and spine. She was bedridden for a long time while she recovered from her injuries. She was in constant pain but she had an indomitable spirit to live. She taught herself to paint, initially inspired by her husband and later on her own. She gained recognition worldwide. The pain she endured while she was alive comes through in some of her works. This is a must see museum in Mexico City. The tickets sell out quickly so buy them well in advance.
name: Yusuf Officewala

text:
A beautiful tour.
It's the most expensive museum in Mexico City (others are around 100 pesos), but it's definitely worth it if you're a fan of Frida's life.
The museum doesn't feature many original works (only replicas), but it does feature excerpts from Frida's diaries and letters. It's an intimate experience of her life and the art of living.

address: 290 Bremner Blvd, Toronto, ON M5V 3L9, Canada
topic: nice, great, amazing, place, food, toronto, views, tacos, good, view
text:
The CN Tower is an iconic part of the Toronto skyline, and a visit here is a must for anyone new to the city. While the price can feel a bit steep‚Äîit almost feels like a "daytime robbery" at times‚Äîthe magnificent views you get from the observation decks make it almost worth the expense.
We visited in late August and found the crowd to be moderate. We didn't have to wait in any excessively long lines, and the staff was friendly and efficient, making the whole process easy to navigate. The accessibility is a big plus, and there is plenty of parking available in the area, which takes a lot of stress out of the visit.
From the top, you get a breathtaking panoramic view of the city, Lake Ontario, and beyond. The glass floor is a thrilling experience and a great photo opportunity. Despite the high cost, the views and overall smooth experience make the CN Tower a solid four-star attraction.
name: Yasar Ergun

address: Av. Central 295, Bosques de Aragon, 57170 Cdad. Nezahualc√≥yotl, M√©x., Mexico
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
The first 3 to 5 times I ordered, it was tasty, an adequate portion, neither too little nor too much, at a good price, and carefully served.
Now, sometimes I keep ordering, not because I like it or love it, but because it's the least bad.
Also, I don't know if it happens to you, but the more times I order, the more ugly and sloppy they send me. It seems that instead of feeling flattered and committed, it makes them angry that I keep ordering.
The Tupperware arrives stained with marks or fingerprints from cream, salsa, etc. The portions are smaller and more expensive. When I order two pozoles, they send the condiments (lettuce, lemons, onion, etc.) only for one pozole, and once they didn't send anything, just the pozole and tostadas for one. If they don't have them anymore, at least let us know so we know if we still want it or not, or cancel the order promptly.
I really liked ordering chilaquiles with steak, but I stopped ordering them because they were more like skin than meat‚Äîpractically skin or tough meat, if you will.
I find the quesadillas very expensive for how small they are.
The flautas sometimes come with a decent portion of chicken and other times with a rough portion.
It's worth mentioning that their menu is practically all tortillas (chilaquiles, enchiladas, flautas, quesadillas, sopes) with decent chicken, but I don't recommend them with steak.
Finally, they raised the prices and reduced the portions.
The tinga (pork) by the gram doesn't say what kind of meat it is; I think it's pork, but they don't mention it, even though they include government-mandated inscriptions, the ingredients are unclear, and their flavor is average, acceptable.
In short, sometimes I keep ordering them, not because I like them or love them, but because they're the least bad.
name: Ivonne Glez.

topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
This is just a review of their red pozole, which is their most popular dish. In general, this chain has decent food (otherwise it wouldn't be so popular) and the prices are low. It's basically one of the cheapest sit-down restaurant chains, but it's trustworthy and consistent.

I had a large red pozole with chicken ($99), and it was served fast and hot, with a generous amount of chicken. However, I highly recommend some lime and a little powdered red pepper. That took the dish from a 3 to a 4.5. There are a ton of servers working there, so just get someone's attention and you will get what you need fast. The interior is bright and clean, but it's utilitarian. Overall good food, good service, and good prices.
name: Darren Gonzalez

text:
The King of Pozole and Antojitos: Exquisite Flavor and Amazing Efficiency

La Casa de To√±o, and the Arag√≥n branch in particular, is for me the ultimate place for Mexican antojitos. They've achieved something incredible: bringing the experience of a traditional neighborhood pozoleria to a chain model without sacrificing flavor.

What I love:

The food is a 10/10: The pozole is consistently delicious, with an authentic, comforting flavor. The rest of the antojitos are simply exquisite. They never disappoint.

The Customer Experience: The service is excellent. Their system is so efficient that from the moment you arrive until you leave, everything flows seamlessly. They are fast, attentive, and never fail to deliver.

An important observation:

The Staff's Work Rate: As a customer, I enjoy impeccable service. However, I can't help but notice the immense pressure the team seems to be working under. The waiters and captains move at a breakneck pace without stopping. While this results in amazing efficiency, it leaves me feeling like a lot is being demanded of them. It's a recognition of the enormous effort they put in.

In short:

The dining experience is first-class, and I always leave more than satisfied. It's my go-to spot when I'm craving Mexican food. Highly recommended!

text:
One of Mexico City's most iconic buildings, the historic Palacio de Bellas Artes (Palace of Fine Arts) hosts ongoing temporary exhibitions, such as this one featuring "The Impressionist Revolution from Monet to Matisse" at the Palace Museum. The cost is $95.00 Mexican pesos per person; students with ID receive a discount. There are museum and palace shops, and there's a small parking lot in the basement.
It truly is one of the few places so accessible to everyone and where we can enjoy world-class exhibitions.
It's a place everyone should visit at least once a year!

text: Views of Toronto. You can see "Toronto in its entirety." We bought tickets in advance for the first and upper levels. If you're short on time, the first level is sufficient. I recommend buying tickets in advance. If the CN Tower website isn't working for you, don't worry; it happens often. Send an email stating that you weren't able to purchase tickets online and detailing the type of tickets you want, for what day and time, and whose name, etc. They'll respond quickly and will have them stored in one of the ticket booths. You'll pay when you pick them up and you'll have skipped one of the lines. Tell the staff there, showing them the response (email), and they'll tell you where to pick them up and get in line.

address: 100 Queens Park, Toronto, ON M5S 2C6, Canada
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
So, I've been stewing on this since Saturday when we went to The R.O.M. for the first time. We (myself, my husband, our adult kids  with one spouse and our granddaughter)  drove almost 3 hours specifically to see the Auschwitz exhibit. Something that is near to my heart because my Nana was a Polish slave during WWII .
We continously checked the website on our way there to make sure time slots were available and at no time did it give any indication the time slots were getting full.
We arrived shortly before 1 p.m. and were advised all time slots were full except 3:40 p.m. .
The person who was helping us purchase tickets for that slot also told us there were only 2 available for that time. But, advised us it was OK. There would be no problem having 4 extra people. He also advised us our best bet was to buy the tickets that allowed us into the other exhibit, the Flemish 300 years of art exhibit.  Assuring us we would have time for both.
We proceeded to buy those tickets to the tune of almost 200 dollars.
He advised us to browse the other areas of the museum (several areas blocked off due to exhibit updates etc). We enjoyed what we were able to see and approximately 30 mins before our alloted time to visit the Auschwitz exhibit made our way back to the elevators to go to that floor.
We were met with a mess. People crowded into the area by the elevators. No one knew where to be. Workers blocking the elevators saying we were unable to go up yet and virtually everyone saying they had tickets for 3:40.
Eventually we were corralled into a line and stood in that line well beyond our alloted time ( 4:40 before we even made it to the elevator. All the while being offered tickets to come another day because *we didn't expect so many people* by museum staff wandering through the line. Interestingly enough we were encouraged to complain to management by these same  staff members.
When we finally got to the entrance of the display it was beyond hot. People were crammed into a small area to wait to get beyond the waiting area.
Once inside there was very little time to actually look at anything before people were being herded in behind us. We spent most of our time waiting for the crowd ahead of us to move forward.
The displays were sparse and consisted mostly of pictures with a few artifacts .
3/4 of the way through the loudspeaker began announcing the museum was closed. Loudly enough that any information being given on the headsets was drowned out.
So, not only were we unable to take a reasonable amount of time to view this important historical information we were unable to even go to the other exhibit we paid to see.
They did refund our money. They also gave us tickets to see the display we missed out on but after the disorganized mess we were shuttled through,  I hesitate to even attempt the journey.
I have honestly seen better displays and organization at little roadside museums in off the beaten track towns.
So disappointing.
I wanted so very much to love this museum and the exhibit we came specifically to see but definitely did not.
What should have been a journey to see what our Nana lived through left us just hot,  sweaty and not even a little more educated than we were when we arrived.

topic: place, wonderful, visit, castle, great, time, lots, awesome, day, go
text:
My family was really looking forward to visiting the ROM and were happy to pay the (expensive) admission fee as there are some interesting areas to explore.

The visit ended in disappointment (and frankly, anger) however, as an exhibition that is very personal to my family, the Auschwitz exhibition, is locked behind a separate entrance fee. It is shameful to gatekeep such an important part of history and should instead be made as accessible as possible to all who are interesting in learning about it, not locked behind an extra ticket tier for more profit.

During our visit it was not even possible to buy another ticket as it was sold out for the day. Awareness of such important (and rightly advertised as ‚Äúnot so long ago‚Äù by the museum itself) pieces of history should never be for profit.
name: Mitch H

text: The experience at the Royal Ontario Museum was very good. The collections are fascinating. The best one of all was the dinosaurs one. A couple of opportunities for improvement: 4th. Floor Exhibition had no washrooms. Also, the benches or sitting spaces all across the museum are extremely limited, which can be challenging as you may want to take a little break from time to time. You are allowed to bring your lunch, but the only place to leave your cooler is in the coat check area (for a fee). You are able to re-enter the museum the same day, so we decided to go to McDonald's for lunch, which was 2 mins. away walking. There is paid parking very close by. Great experience, highly recommended.

text:
I'd heard a lot about this place, so I went out of curiosity and thought it was a good option.
They serve you well from the moment you arrive; the tables are spaced for 2, 4, or more people.
They're always attentive and serve you well. The dishes aren't very complicated, but they're delicious.
I ordered enchiladas, which were very good!
The coffee was delicious, as was their bread. I ordered hot chocolate, and they heated it up.
It's spacious, cool, and well-lit; it's not expensive.
They have a supervisor who walks around asking how you were served.
It's worth a visit.

text:
The main museum in Canada has the worst organization!!! I bought my ticket at 2:00 pm, and it indicated that I needed to be at the special exhibition entrance for 4:00 pm. This meant I had to wait inside the museum for almost two hours before being allowed in.
When I finally entered, the exhibition was overcrowded and moved very slowly. I don‚Äôt mind that many people are there, but the flow was so poorly managed that it became impossible to enjoy. At 5:30 pm, the museum announced it was closing, even though I hadn‚Äôt even made it through half of the exhibition.
It makes no sense to sell tickets with a 4:00 pm entry time if visitors are not given enough time to experience the entire exhibition!!This completely spoiled my day, and I left feeling frustrated and disappointed, especially since it is 90$ entrance fee for 2 adults.

text:
Saturday, May 31, 3:30 p.m. We visited the Casa To√±o branch located on D√≠az Mir√≥n, in the Miguel Hidalgo borough. Unlike other branches, this one tends to be less busy, so the wait time was minimal.

As with all Casa To√±o restaurants, the food is good and affordable. That day we tried:
‚Ä¢ Steak tacos: very tasty and generous portions for the price.
‚Ä¢ Minced pork tostadas: hearty and delicious.
‚Ä¢ Potato and cheese quesadilla: highly recommended.
‚Ä¢ Dessert: coffee with vanilla concha, also quite good.

The advantages of this place are clear: speed, flavor, and price. You'll rarely find anything negative, although it's true that the dishes are delicious without being extraordinary.

In short: Casa To√±o is a highly recommended place for any time of day, whether breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Delicious, fast, and affordable food‚Äîa formula that's hard to fail.

topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
It is a good place to go to eat a rich Mexican pozole accompanied by some tasty flautas which can be assorted or can be the three of the same selection of taste and these can be normal or drowned in a variety of sauces which in my opinion do not sting, but they always put different types of sauces on the table for tasting, I recommend the guacamole which they put in a bottle on the table, and this is not charged.

For dessert I highly recommend the flan de cajeta de la abuela and for drinks there is a great variety from aguas frescas, soft drinks to beers. I recommend the place because the service is quite fast, maybe at the reception you can wait up to 10 minutes but once you are inside the service is fast, so I suggest by education in Mexico leave at least 10% tip as a basis, this varies depending on the service you receive from the waiters.

If you are a foreigner and want to try Mexican cuisine I recommend this place, it is nice, good and cheap.

address: Calz. de las √Åguilas 1019, Amp √Åguilas, √Ålvaro Obreg√≥n, 01759 Ciudad de M√©xico, CDMX, Mexico
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text:
I placed an order through La Casa de To√±o's new WhatsApp system, since they are no longer available on Rappi or Uber Eats. I followed all the steps: I shared my location in real time and wrote my full address, which was confirmed by their team. Until then, everything is correct.

I received a tracking link through Uber, but when the delivery driver left I noticed that they sent the order to the wrong address. I contacted the delivery person, but he told me that he could not change the address and that I had to deliver it as is. If I cannot deliver it, I would return it to the restaurant.

I immediately contacted La Casa de To√±o's WhatsApp service. After much insistence, they told me that I would have to personally go to the branch for the order, that they would only keep it for an hour and that, if I didn't go, they would throw it away. They rejected any type of refund or solution, arguing that this is what their terms and conditions indicate.

The unfair thing is that I did correctly provide my location and address, which was confirmed by them, therefore the "wrong address" policy does not apply. The most disappointing thing was the lack of empathy, real care and solutions. I also called customer service and they told me that they could only assist me through WhatsApp, to repeat the same thing: "There are no refunds or resends."

I recommend being very careful when placing orders via WhatsApp with La Casa de To√±o. Their system has flaws, their service is slow, and in the event of an error they are not responsible, even if the error was theirs.

A big disappointment from a restaurant I used to go to often. I hope they can improve their service and customer service.
name: Manolo Santiago

text: If you wish to wander amongst the achievment, the dreams and the wonders of years past and witness relics of the triumph and tragedy that is the human story, then you need look no further dear passerby. Within lie the sacred offerings to ancient gods, testaments to deeds of greatness from the years of yore and works of art infused with the very soul of their makers. Gaze into the eyes of men and women from long ago and let their glances haunt you and their memories stir you. The evolution of countless species and the forms of strange and astounding creatures and all there for you to see. The complexity of the bowels of our planet are all collected for your searching eyes. You might spend all day amongst these wonders and not tire of them. I avidly recommend such an institution to your enjoyment.
name: Jack Burns

address: 100 Queens Park, Toronto, ON M5S 2C6, Canada
topic: beautiful, cathedral, history, incredible, many, architecture, mexico, impressive, full, place
text:
ROM is not friendly to special needs children.

My son has low muscle tone, developmental delays, and is autistic. Upon arrival, we were told to check in our wagon and were offered a stroller as an alternative. Unfortunately, the stroller provided was undersized, causing his feet to drag on the ground. This discomfort triggered sensory issues, prompting him to remove his shoes repeatedly throughout the visit.

We rely on a wagon during outings to carry his essentials such as diapers and water, and to provide a sense of comfort and security. Additionally, it helps reduce the uncomfortable attention he sometimes receives when using a stroller due to his age and size.

What was especially disheartening was seeing other families inside the museum using wagons, which made the situation feel inconsistent and unfair.

Navigating public spaces with a special needs child is already difficult, and we had hoped for a more supportive and inclusive experience.
name: D Ngo

A very large museum where you can appreciate all kinds of art. The areas I liked most were the dinosaurs and the Egyptian section, featuring real specimens. Very well-maintained and well-organized, with hardly any lines to enter the museum if you have pre-purchased your ticket.
Also, there was an Auswich exhibition that same day that we were there, which we were able to enjoy by purchasing it in addition to the museum ticket. Although the audio guide is only available in English or French, it doesn't hinder our enjoyment of the exhibition.

topic: place, wonderful, visit, castle, great, time, lots, awesome, day, go
text: We visited the CN tower yesterday. Despite not booking ahead, we barely queued to buy our tickets and then go up to the top. Note that we went up towards the end of the afternoon to catch the sunset. Which we did! The different viewpoints are worth it. However, at the beginning of the visit, the Tower staff takes pictures of the visitors as souvenir. We were very surprised to discover at the end of our visit that the pictures were already printed, but that they costed $45 + taxes. If you don‚Äôt buy them, they get shredded. What a waste of resources! We didn‚Äôt buy them because of the outrageous price (equivalent to a one-person ticket up the tower). It was very disappointing to end on this note - and to know our smily pictures were about to be shredded.

address: 100 Queens Park, Toronto, ON M5S 2C6, Canada
topic: place, wonderful, visit, castle, great, time, lots, awesome, day, go
text:
Auschwitz Exhibit:
This exhibit was fascinating, thorough, and well thought out. The audio device with headphones was fabulous. The artifacts were thoughtfully chosen, with detailed information about them. The replicas/ and or the actual artifacts were perfectly preserved. The videos/audio gave a lot of life to the exhibit and really demonstrated what happened in Auschwitz to its victims. I especially loved the probably lesser known people, i.e. the carpenter who made a box for the SS after his skills were discovered. I did find the exhibits/displays a bit confusing. It was hard to figure out where to start in each room after the big red signs introducing each room. Before you go, you need to read up on the camps/WW2. I think it would be confusing if you did not know what happened. I don't think it is a place for children-only because of the density of the content. There is a lot of reading, listening, and watching. I spent 3 hours there and I don't think the parents/ adults with kids would get the same kind of experience. Also, the parents/ adults would get distracted with the kids and not focus on the exhibit. What I really found interesting was the silence.....everyone had their headphones on and even in between the audio excerpts, people were quiet. It was a respectful environment and conducive to learning. I do wish there was someone at the end I could have asked questions. It is well worth the trip and the cost.
name: Nancy

address: 100 Queens Park, Toronto, ON M5S 2C6, Canada
topic: place, wonderful, visit, castle, great, time, lots, awesome, day, go
text:
I recently had the chance to visit the Royal Ontario Museum (ROM), and it was a truly memorable experience. The museum is massive and beautifully designed, with an impressive infrastructure that immediately captures your attention.
Even though I had only about an hour to explore (as the museum closes at 5:30 PM on Sundays), I was able to see a wide variety of fascinating exhibits. From historical artifacts to species displays, crystals, diaspores, and cultural history exhibits, there was so much to take in. The museum does a great job of curating items from different time periods and parts of the world, offering a rich blend of natural history, art, and culture.
One hour was definitely not enough to explore everything thoroughly‚Äîthis is the kind of place you could easily spend half a day in if you're someone who enjoys history, science, and art. I‚Äôd highly recommend arriving earlier in the day to make the most of your visit.
Whether you're a tourist or a local, the ROM is absolutely worth visiting at least once. It's educational, inspiring, and a great place to appreciate the beauty and depth of human and natural history.

address: 290 Bremner Blvd, Toronto, ON M5V 3L9, Canada
topic: nice, great, amazing, place, food, toronto, views, tacos, good, view
text:
This is the landmark telecommunications tower and tourist attraction in the city centre of Toronto. It was constructed between 1973-75 and at 553 metres in height was the tallest freestanding structure in the world until 2007. The CN Tower dominates the Toronto skyline and can be viewed fairly well throughout the city.

Visitors have sightseeing and dining opportunities at the CN Tower. The Observation level is open from 9am to 11pm daily. Timed tickets start at CND$45 per adult and can be reserved online in advance or purchased on the day at the ticketing office. Adventure travellers can also try the Edgewalk attraction while diners have several eatery options including a sit down restaurant with 360 degree views of the city. The restaurant opening hours are 11.30am to 3pm (lunch) and 4.30pm to 10pm (dinner) daily.

text: The Palace of Fine Arts is one of those places that always impresses me, no matter how many times I visit. From the outside, its architecture is imposing, with that mix of white marble and details that make it unique in the city. Inside, murals by artists like Diego Rivera and Siqueiros give it an enormous cultural power, and every corner seems to tell a part of Mexico's history. What I enjoy most is that it's not just a museum; it's also a living space that hosts concerts, operas, and various shows. Being there gives me a sense of pride and connection to the culture, because it represents the best of Mexican art and creativity.

text:
Alhamdulillah,
Excited to share about the Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) in Toronto! üá®üá¶

This is a special moment in my journey of exploring the world‚Äôs history and culture.

Founded in 1914, the Royal Ontario Museum is one of North America‚Äôs largest museums, dedicated to natural history, world cultures, and art. Over the decades, ROM has become a hub for learning, research, and global heritage, attracting millions of visitors every year. Its Michael Lee-Chin Crystal, a modern architectural addition, beautifully blends contemporary design with historical elegance.

From the Australian art galleries that inspired creativity,
to the Hiroshima Peace Memorial that taught reflection and hope,
and the Auckland War Museum that honored bravery and history,
each visit has enriched my perspective.

Now, ROM adds a Canadian chapter with its amazing artifacts, dinosaur skeletons, and world cultures. Its treasures and iconic architecture make it a must-visit for anyone passionate about history and art.

Every museum I visit connects me more deeply to human creativity, resilience, and heritage.

Can‚Äôt wait to explore and learn more!
name: Mahbubur Rahman

address: 100 Queens Park, Toronto, ON M5S 2C6, Canada
topic: food, service, bad, tacos, order, dont, even, like, time, good
text: recent visitor to Museum.  Attended Auschwitz exhibit expected to be impressed with presentation.  Was surprised at how very much toned down to almost a first grade presentation of the events.  Not shocking, not a presentation that one would feel bad.  Don't like using the word other than toned down.  Lacking shock value.  The current generation should be told the truth and not something that is so very much watered down.  I felt even some academic censorship of the subject was presented.  Sad to see.  Would not recommend any other institution use this exhibit that is far, far too tame.  Did not give any sense of the horror of this location or of the events.  Where were the photos or films of corpses and bodies discovered by the Russian army?  None of this was presented and should have been at the very least.
name: J D

address: 100 Queens Park, Toronto, ON M5S 2C6, Canada
topic: place, wonderful, visit, castle, great, time, lots, awesome, day, go
text: I arrived that ROM after an unexpected long walk from the Museum subway station not feeling well at all. I'm a senior and  the staff on the floor especially a security guard called Mara was extremely kind and helpful during my experience. She got me a wheelchair that my daughter pushed me around in, and I got to see the exhibits that I do specifically came down to Toronto to see. I cannot say enough for her help. And at the end of the day when we were leaving, she again was there to say goodbye and we had a good chuckle at my experience, but she definitely made my day better. The museum itself is fantastic. And while it would probably be the last time I will come here due to the distance that I live from the Toronto I have thoroughly enjoyed visiting here over the last seventy years.
name: Teri Lancaster

"red" it even seems like a joke. The red chilaquiles are inedible. I do not recommend this cuisine or the cooks here at all. BAD experience I had here.

text:
We came to Toronto for a girls weekend! This was a stop in our first night!  We loved it! We made timed entry reservations for 8:15 at night. Very low wait in a very fast line to enter. It was great. The ride up in the elevator was thrilling! And then the views from both decks, spectacular. We had a very clear evening! And we were seeing the city right at sunset. So the twilight was gorgeous.
The gift shop was also great on our way out. I highly recommend a visit to the CN Tower!! A Toronto ‚Äúmust!‚Äù
